It also mentions that users can manage their information and that the app applies protections regardless of where the data is processed. However, it implies that users must also take responsibility for the accuracy and legality of the information they provide.
response: Your account information on the Keep app is generally safe, as the privacy policy states that personal information will not be disclosed to non-affiliated third parties without your consent. However, you are responsible for maintaining the accuracy of your information, and the app applies protections consistently regardless of data processing locations.

response: Yes, your data is anonymized when used for research purposes, as it is de-identified and stripped of personal identifiers, meaning you cannot be reasonably identified as an individual.
retrieved_contexts:
View our Transparency Report for more information.

Aggregate Information: information that has been combined with that of other users and analyzed or evaluated as a whole, such that no specific individual may be reasonably identified.
De-identified Information: information that has been stripped of your Registration Information (eg, your name and contact information) and other identifying data such that you cannot reasonably be identified as an individual, also known as pseudonymized information.

user_input: Consider "Viber Messenger"'s privacy policy; who will be able to see my information and/or the messages that i send?
thought: The context explains that information posted on public features can be seen by others, and that the admin of a Community can control access to messages. It also mentions that personal information may be shared with trusted third parties and that users can manage their privacy settings. However, it emphasizes that Viber's core features are secured with end-to-end encryption, meaning that one-on-one messages and calls are private unless shared publicly.
response: Your information and messages can be seen by other users if posted in public features or Communities, depending on the privacy settings. However, one-on-one messages and calls are secured with end-to-end encryption, meaning they are private unless shared publicly.
